title: bookmarks gone
content: FF updated without warning this AM and now my bookmarks have gone. History is still there. Any solution. ? I have been getting more and more disappointed with some of these "upgrades" and have dropped it off my Android devices because of the stupid interface. Looks like I might have to drop it off my Win machines. Thanks Greg
creator: greggtr

title: search from address bar
content:
How can I turn off the search from the address bar? I have an old FIREFOX HOME Page with Google search bar the middle of the page. I went to type a search in and there were no words being typed; instead, the cursor auto jumped to the address bar and typed the search there. I don't want that! I don't like that! Can it be stopped? Firefox 89.0.1 (64-bit), 06/18/2021

Please help.
creator: DrWizard

title: Bing keeps replacing my window content - Google is default search engine
content: I have the latest version of Firefox & my windows 10 update automatically. After the last Firefox update this week I will be browsing a webpage and all of a sudden a Bing page is loaded over the top with a preformatted search term as though I was searching for that term. It's really annoying as I've always preferred Google anyway. When I search for something in the address bar, it loads a Bing page, but when I open a new tab it loads my preferred page, Google with Firefox. I don't have Bing selected as a search engine in my options. How can I get rid of it please?
creator: eva37

title: error "VCRUNTIME140_1.dll was not found" occurs when Office 365 is uninstalled, lost bookmarks
content:
I am having issues with activation of an existing O365 subscription. After hours working with Microsoft Office support the issue is still not resolved.

That is seemingly unrelated to Firefox, yet when trying to resolve the issue I uninstalled O365 twice, I could not open Firefox. I received the error "VCRUNTIME140_1.dll was not found". After reinstalling O365, I was able to access Firefox but all of my bookmark folders are gone.

How do I recover those bookmark folders (with hundreds of bookmarks--if they're permanently gone, it will be a significant loss). AND why would uninstalling O365 affect Firefox?
creator: PogoStick99

title: Firefox displays text highly pixellated
content: Firefox is displaying text in SOME windows so highly pixellated that it is unreadable. Other browsers display the same windows normally. This has been going on for a couple of months now. I really like(d) Firefox befo0re this happened. Since other browsers display correctly, I feel that it is not a hardware problem. Firefox also covers SOME graphics with green.bold text
creator: ceserkland

title: Restoring bookmarks.
content: The motherboard died on my old laptop running Win 10. Is there a way I can restore the bookmarks in my new Win 10 laptop from the old hard drive. Thanks
creator: vegasgmc
